text: Jerome (; ; ; â€“ 30 September 420), was a Christian priest, theologian and historian. He lived in the Roman Empire. He is best known for translating the Bible into Latin (the Vulgate). He is recognised as a saint by the Catholic Church, the Eastern Orthodox Church, the Lutheran Church, and the Church of England (Anglican Communion). ==References== ==Other websites== *Saint Jerome at the Catholic Encyclopedia Category:340s births Category:420 deaths Category:Ancient Roman historians Category:Bible translators Category:Doctors of the Church Category:Christian saints Category:Early Christian theologians
title: Jerome
